intro: Canthium tamatavense, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Canthium tamatavense is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies.
